46Cs0y.value: I'm not that hard to find, look:

71KGgl.value: I love to play music. I play cavaquinho, banjo and tambourine. Playing samba on the street is my vibe. If going to the beach is possible, I'm easily there. Whenever I can, I carry my surfboard to the sea. I love a good adventure. Especially if it's on a board. Let's take a skate ride? I have 2!

7xYPxA.value: I grew up in Petrópolis, a small town in Rio de Janeiro. Things weren't so easy.

children.value: At the age of 14, I discovered my form of expression in programming

7xYPxA.value: . A few years and projects later, at 17, Atados hired me as a freelancer to build their first international platform. They invited me to move to São Paulo, 400 kilometers away. I accepted the invitation and ventured into a new city at age 19

9/DcFj.value: I code and design to make the world a better place

AOsrhY.value: Prototype: App for managing personal finances

FOsGM9.value: This plugin automatically creates GraphQL types and resolvers by transforming your TypeORM models into a GraphQL API

JflVZj.value: Control your own personal finances through a simple, easy to use interface. For me, it was challenging to register and keeping track of all my personal expenses, so I decided to find an easier way to do it and prototyped this app.

K5hD19.value: Code as a form of expression

QpMbuR.value: In São Paulo I got to know a very diverse range of people. Working at Atados I made friends for life. I met sensitive people who gave me a space to create which strengthened my empathy, my listening skills, and vulnerable expression.

VOTlCZ.value:
A React-based web app to empower social projects. Project creators used it to find and manage volunteers and receive donations through a payment integration. On the other side, volunteers could match themselves with projects and follow a volunteer path.

I was the main front-end developer and liaised with the back-end developer to integrate with our API on our main product and in client-specific platforms. For the payment integration, I worked as the back-end developer, where I created Lambda functions to serve as our integration bridge. It allowed us to receive R$200,000+ (Brazilian real) in March of 2020. I also worked as a back-end developer to enable our white-label features. In this role, I created a system where a platform for a client could easily overwrite parts of our app to function according to the client's needs.

To improve the development experience, I added continuous integration to improve the deployment process. The integration validated the new app version, deployed previews, and guaranteed that every client was up to date with the app core.

VZSoaa.value: Open to receive proposals, ideas and kind words :)

WK/SgI.value: It's not all about work all the time

gFe2rH.value: Hi - I came through your portfolio

h/PBBt.value: I learned to listen, feel, communicate and ask for help. Looking back, I see that deciding not to go to college and moving to São Paulo to work was the best decision I could have made. It was through learning in practice that I created my own path.

hqh7Hj.value: Lexer, Parser and AST. A study to understand how languages are read and compiled.

With a unique combination of design and development experience, I build professional, pixel-perfect interfaces in a short amount of time.
